description:
Amazon's Explore group (www.
amazon.
com/explore) is looking for a Senior Manager of Business Development to lead their BD team.
You will work with your peer teams and partners to innovate on behalf of our customers to create and maintain new and exciting experiences.
You will continuously work on improving our products by cooperating with your business partners and stakeholders to delight our customers.
As Business Development Manager you will define your roadmap, identify partners, execute on key business relationships and grow existing relationships that will enable us to offer a compelling selection to our customers.
You will be working closely with teams and senior executives.
As the ideal candidate you will be experienced in managing a multi-discipline organization.
You will also be a strong communicator and will have proven abilities in managing through ambiguous situations.
Specific responsibilities include the following:
- Hire and Develop a a world class team.
- Define and drive your long term strategy based on your relationships with key customers and partners.
- Define and execute on a strategic market development plan and ensure that it aligns with the Amazon Explore strategic direction, in partnership with key internal stakeholders (e.
g.
sales teams, product teams, marketing, partner teams, legal, support, etc.
).
- Construct the business development pipeline by defining and sizing segments, identifying and engaging key customers, consultants, and partners.
- Understand the technology requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of our product offerings.
- Present business reviews to senior management regarding progress in, and roadblocks to, expanding our reach in the industry.
- Manage complex contract negotiations and liaise with the legal group.
- Be conversant with salesforce.
com and be able to use other internal Amazon systems.
Inclusive Team Culture:
Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences.
We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion.
We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally.
We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences.
Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
.
Estimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
